text:
As part of our initiatives to mark #UniMentalHealthDay üí≠ on 5th March, @citysportec1 is participating in London Wellbeing Week, which takes place from 2nd ‚Äì 6th March.‚Å†
‚Å†
London Wellbeing Week aims to showcase and celebrate the work that higher education institutions in London are doing to support students and staff in their mental and physical health and wellbeing.‚Å†
‚Å†
CitySport will be hosting a range of additional free activities throughout the week, open to all. You can register over the phone, via email or at CitySport reception. Timetable below:‚Å†
‚Å†
üíÉ 02/03/20 - 18.30-19.30, Zumba (we bring this to you, College Building, Great Hall)‚Å†
‚Å†
üéæ 03/03/20 - 12.00-1pm, social badminton and table tennis (CitySport Sports Hall)‚Å†
‚Å†
üèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 04/03/20 -18.30-19.15, Boot Camp (CitySport Studio 1&2)‚Å†
‚Å†
üè∏ 05/03/20 - 12.00-13.00, pop up badminton (around Campus)‚Å†
‚Å†
‚òÅÔ∏è 05/03/20 - 17.15-17.50 Mind and body stress relief (CitySport Studio 3&4)‚Å†
‚Å†
üí™ All week: BIG GYM CHALLENGE on the gym floor üí™‚Å†
‚Å†
Follow @citysportec1 for updates.‚Å†
‚Å†
Open to City students, staff & CitySport members. Registration is essential!‚Å†
‚Å†
#citysport #london #cityuniversityoflondon #fitnessmotivation #fitnessgoals #sport #mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #londonlife‚Å†

text:
Students across @unioflondon institutions presented their ideas for a more sustainable future at the London Student Sustainability Conference, hosted at City last week üåç‚Å†
‚Å†
Student presentations included ideas on alternatives to fast fashion, prevention of clogged waterways through toilet flushing and how climate change has increased the spread of Malaria.‚Å†
‚Å†
Sustainability-focused City student, Rachel Shamtoob (MSc Management), said: ‚ÄúAs I‚Äôve grown up I have realised that my decisions have a big impact on our society and the planet. These small choices have long-term effects, so being mindful of what I am putting my money into is crucial in becoming more sustainable. An event like this is so important as we can all find our sustainable niche, whether that be fashion, plastic waste or carbon emissions."‚Å†
‚Å†
You can watch Rachel's takeover of the conference on our Instagram stories highlight on our profile page!‚Å†
‚Å†
#ThisisCity #SustainableCity #Sustainability #CityUniversityofLondon #SustainableDevelopmentGoals #SDGs
linkedText: Students across @unioflondon institutions presented their ideas for a more sustainable future at the London Student Sustainability Conference, hosted at City last week üåç‚Å† ‚Å† Student presentations included ideas on alternatives to fast fashion, prevention of clogged waterways through toilet flushing and how climate change has increased the spread of Malaria.‚Å† ‚Å† Sustainability-focused City student, Rachel Shamtoob (MSc Management), said: ‚ÄúAs I‚Äôve grown up I have realised that my decisions have a big impact on our society and the planet. These small choices have long-term effects, so being mindful of what I am putting my money into is crucial in becoming more sustainable. An event like this is so important as we can all find our sustainable niche, whether that be fashion, plastic waste or carbon emissions."‚Å† ‚Å† You can watch Rachel's takeover of the conference on our Instagram stories highlight on our profile page!‚Å† ‚Å† @ThisisCity @SustainableCity @Sustainability @CityUniversityofLondon @SustainableDevelopmentGoals @SDGs

text:
Meet Rachel Shamtoob üëã (üì∑ @rachelshamtoob) ‚Å†‚Å†
This Thursday, we will be handing over our Instagram to Rachel to give us a first-hand experience of the London Student Sustainability Conference (#LSSC20)... Rachel is an MSc student from @cassbusinessschool who has interned in the #sustainability sector. From keynote speeches to student interviews Rachel will be guiding us through the day.‚Å†
‚Å†
The Conference is a chance to get to know what our students have been doing to drive innovation and change in society. Whether you‚Äôre interested in networking with academics and professionals from @unioflondon or you‚Äôre just looking to broaden your knowledge of today‚Äôs most critical issues, #LSSC20 creates an open environment to inspire all guests üíö‚Å†
‚Å†
For more information and to register for free tickets visit city.ac.uk/events or join the conversation on social media using #LSSC20! Rachel will be taking over the @Sustain_City account on Twitter and the @cityuniversitylondon on Instagram on Thursday.
linkedText: Meet Rachel Shamtoob üëã (üì∑ @rachelshamtoob) ‚Å†‚Å† This Thursday, we will be handing over our Instagram to Rachel to give us a first-hand experience of the London Student Sustainability Conference (@LSSC20)... Rachel is an MSc student from @cassbusinessschool who has interned in the @sustainability sector. From keynote speeches to student interviews Rachel will be guiding us through the day.‚Å† ‚Å† The Conference is a chance to get to know what our students have been doing to drive innovation and change in society. Whether you‚Äôre interested in networking with academics and professionals from @unioflondon or you‚Äôre just looking to broaden your knowledge of today‚Äôs most critical issues, @LSSC20 creates an open environment to inspire all guests üíö‚Å† ‚Å† For more information and to register for free tickets visit city.ac.uk/events or join the conversation on social media using @LSSC20! Rachel will be taking over the @Sustain_City account on Twitter and the @cityuniversitylondon on Instagram on Thursday.

text:
"Every student in this Programme is unique. We have our own achievements, goals, views and challenges. Wecame from all over the world to be here in London and study at City. We personally chose this University to build something truly remarkable, to reach a new level in our career and to get a better understanding of a special field of law.

I saw students achieving their goals: winning prizes, scholarships and internships. Besides, they made new friends on the way, collected wealth of experience, explored the London life. And as typical Londoners, we complained about the British weather or the crowded tube. All in all, we lived the life that a student shall live in London. A life that we will never forget." @rekamezo (LLM graduate and student speaker, City Law School)

#CityGrad #LLM #Postgraduate #LawSchool #Graduate
linkedText: "Every student in this Programme is unique. We have our own achievements, goals, views and challenges. Wecame from all over the world to be here in London and study at City. We personally chose this University to build something truly remarkable, to reach a new level in our career and to get a better understanding of a special field of law. I saw students achieving their goals: winning prizes, scholarships and internships. Besides, they made new friends on the way, collected wealth of experience, explored the London life. And as typical Londoners, we complained about the British weather or the crowded tube. All in all, we lived the life that a student shall live in London. A life that we will never forget." @rekamezo (LLM graduate and student speaker, City Law School) @CityGrad @LLM @Postgraduate @LawSchool @Graduate

text:
Choosing to live and study in London is a big decision (and one that you will definitely not regret!) üåÜ‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä
City is located at the heart of one of the most vibrant cities in the world. Named the best city worldwide in which to study by QS Best Student Cities 2018, #London is described as "a nerve-centre of global academia". But it‚Äôs not just all work and no play. However you like to spend your free time, life at City offers a huge range of opportunities for international students.‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä
Hear 6 of our international students share their personal experiences of moving to London and starting life anew...‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä
üëâüìΩÔ∏è https://youtu.be/NitudSy3m5A‚Å†‚†Ä
‚Å†‚†Ä

linkedText: Choosing to live and study in London is a big decision (and one that you will definitely not regret!) üåÜ‚Å†‚†Ä ‚Å†‚†Ä City is located at the heart of one of the most vibrant cities in the world. Named the best city worldwide in which to study by QS Best Student Cities 2018, @London is described as "a nerve-centre of global academia". But it‚Äôs not just all work and no play. However you like to spend your free time, life at City offers a huge range of opportunities for international students.‚Å†‚†Ä ‚Å†‚†Ä Hear 6 of our international students share their personal experiences of moving to London and starting life anew...‚Å†‚†Ä ‚Å†‚†Ä üëâüìΩÔ∏è https://youtu.be/NitudSy3m5A‚Å†‚†Ä ‚Å†‚†Ä @LondonisMyCampus @InternationalCityWeek @WeAreInternational @StudyLondon @LondonLife @StudentLife @InternationalStudy @StudyAbroad

text:
‚ÄúWe live in a time of constant changes around job security. What is certain is the way we choose to carry ourselves in the world with the skills and knowledge we now have.

Let us come together and use these skills to create changes in our society that we wish to see. It may not feel like it recently, but we do hold power in our knowledge, love and empathy. So be kind, be honest and continue to work towards your goals.‚Äù Ilyeh Nahdi (MSc Speech and Language Therapy)

text:
"It is an honour to be a part of this NHS with people who during the toughest times hold on to that goodwill, with people who realise that it is an incredible privilege to be a part of the best and the worst days of people‚Äôs lives. 
The circumstances within which we‚Äôve trained have taught us to be the person that goes above and beyond to ensure the quality of care we are delivering to patients is unwavering by the challenging limited resources and ever-growing demand.
Finally, 5 simple words that have never been more apt in this current climate and credited to Ellen DeGeneres, ‚Äúbe kind to one another‚Äù - An inspiring speech from this morning's student speaker, Marina Nobre-Brage Guimaraes @marinanbg (MSc Mental Health Nursing)

#CityGrad üéì

text:
Last week City's Journalism department welcomed the visit from representatives of two charitable organisations, Randeree Charitable Trust and the Cosaraf Charitable Foundation, supporting the offer of a pair of Postgraduate Scholarships for the 2019/20 academic year. In addition to the scholarships, the students will also be completing paid placements in The Daily Mirror and The Sun.

The Widening Media Diversity Scholarships were awarded to two exceptional students who are facing financial hardship and are actively engaged in British Muslim communities as well as interested in developing Muslim and general diversity in journalism.

Shayma Bakht, one of the scholars that received the scholarship expressed her thanks and plans for the future by saying "It‚Äôs encouraging to see the industry take active steps to diversify the media. I am so grateful to have been selected by City and the donors to become a Widening Media Diversity Scholar, and I am determined to pave the way for more women, from my background, to enter the field of journalism." During the visit, the representatives from the charitable organisations met the scholarship recipients as well as a representative from The Sun and Journalism Department academics - enjoying a tour of the department and discussing the importance of diversity in media.

Jonathan Freeman from Cosaraf Charitable Organisation said "The COSARAF Foundation is delighted to be supporting these incredible young students and knows that their studies at City University will set them up for glittering careers in journalism! It is so important that this fantastic opportunity is available to individuals from all communities to ensure that the media is reflective of all parts of our society." Below are a select few photos of the visit.
The group photo includes - from the left: Jonathan Freeman (Cosaraf Charitable Foundation), Paul Clarkson (The Sun), Shayma Bakht (MA Broadcast Journalism / Widening Media Diversity Scholar), Dr Paul Lashmar (Head of the Department of Journalism), Momodou Touray (MA International Journalism / Widening Media Diversity Scholar), Fatimah Ashrif (Randeree Charitable Trust)

Shayma Bakht, one of the scholars that received the scholarship expressed her thanks and plans for the future by saying "It‚Äôs encouraging to see the industry take active steps to diversify the media. I am so grateful to have been selected by City and the donors to become a Widening Media Diversity Scholar, and I am determined to pave the way for more women, from my background, to enter the field of journalism." During the visit, the representatives from the charitable organisations met the scholarship recipients as well as a representative from The Sun and Journalism Department academics - enjoying a tour of the department and discussing the importance of diversity in media.

Jonathan Freeman from Cosaraf Charitable Organisation said "The COSARAF Foundation is delighted to be supporting these incredible young students and knows that their studies at City University will set them up for glittering careers in journalism! It is so important that this fantastic opportunity is available to individuals from all communities to ensure that the media is reflective of all parts of our society." text:
We're thrilled to announce that our @cassbusinessschool full-time MBA has been rated as the top 12-month MBA in London by the latest @financialtimes Global MBA 2020 rankings! ‚Å†
‚Å†
The programme has been named 6th in the UK and also achieved its joint highest-ever position in Europe. Alongside the overall accolades, Cass has been ranked as 2nd in the world for corporate strategy and 9th for international business.‚Å†
‚Å†
#London #LondonisMyCampus #CityUniversityofLondon #ThisisCity #CassBusinessSchool #StudyLondon #MBA‚Å†

text:
‚ÄúI think I speak on behalf of everyone here today when I say that Cass Business School is one of the best academic institutions in the country. The professionalism and dedication of the careers team is unparalleled. The academic quality and rigour at Cass are second to none. And the school‚Äôs connections with London‚Äôs financial sector are unrivalled. Most importantly though, I feel incredibly fortunate to have met so many amazing people throughout my time at Cass. I leave here today not only with a degree but also with amazing friendships that I am sure will last forever.‚Äù - @cassbusinessschool student speaker, Peter Harrison (MSc Finance) üéì

#CityGrad

text:
Meet Rachel Shamtoob üëã (üì∑ @rachelshamtoob) ‚Å†‚Å†
.
This Thursday, @cityuniversitylondon will be handing over their Instagram to Rachel to give a first-hand experience of the London Student Sustainability Conference (#LSSC20)... Rachel is a Cass MSc student from who has interned in the #sustainability sector. From keynote speeches to student interviews Rachel will be guiding us through the day.‚Å†
‚Å†.
The Conference is a chance to get to know what our students have been doing to drive innovation and change in society. Whether you‚Äôre interested in networking with academics and professionals from @unioflondon or you‚Äôre just looking to broaden your knowledge of today‚Äôs most critical issues, #LSSC20 creates an open environment to inspire all guests üíö‚Å†
‚Å†.
For more information and to register for free tickets visit city.ac.uk/events or join the conversation on social media using #LSSC20! Rachel will be taking over the @Sustain_City account on Twitter and the @cityuniversitylondon on Instagram on Thursday.

text: On the anniversary of the baptism of John Cass, we'd like to reflect on the legacy of our namesake. Born in London in 1661, Sir John Cass was a successful businessman and philanthropist and in 1709, he founded a school for 50 boys and 40 girls. #Cass #SirJohnCass

text:
Michelle Fredman (MA International Journalism 2020) graduated today with a Distinction after beating cancer twice: ‚ÄúThe most poignant lesson I learned during my time at City, and one I hope will resonate with you, is the importance of owning your story. 
I once believed being different from others was a sign of weakness. Now, after an especially trying year, I see it as my greatest asset. 
Many of us will likely face pressure to fit into the status quo, to find our own small place amongst the huddled masses making their way to their offices each morning. But even within the systems we may slip into, it should not be forgotten that our individual passions, histories and desires, our failures and radical ideas, this is where we will find true joy, meaning and strength. 
Own your differences, share your story, and show compassion to others." ‚ú®

#CityGrad
linkedText: Michelle Fredman (MA International Journalism 2020) graduated today with a Distinction after beating cancer twice: ‚ÄúThe most poignant lesson I learned during my time at City, and one I hope will resonate with you, is the importance of owning your story. Many of us will likely face pressure to fit into the status quo, to find our own small place amongst the huddled masses making their way to their offices each morning. But even within the systems we may slip into, it should not be forgotten that our individual passions, histories and desires, our failures and radical ideas, this is where we will find true joy, meaning and strength. Own your differences, share your story, and show compassion to others." ‚ú® @CityGrad
